subclusters.subcluster_name: Persistent DNA Double-Strand Break Accumulation Theory
DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Metabolic Decline Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Persistent DNA Double-Strand Break Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on persistent unrepaired DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs) and their role in aging and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Persistent DNA Double-Strand Break Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on accumulation of irreversible DSBs and imperfect repair via NHEJ contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Persistent DNA Double-Strand Break Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of DSBs in stem cells impairing function and driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Persistent DNA Double-Strand Break Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation in stem cells, especially DSBs, leading to stem cell exhaustion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on decline in DNA polymerase alpha activity and fidelity causing replication errors and genomic instability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA repair efficiency and regulation as fundamental to aging and longevity variability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows high expression of DNA repair genes like BRCA1 correlates with longevity and genome maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links accumulation of DNA damage and somatic mutations with aging modulated by DNA repair capacity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA repair deficiency (ERCC1) causing genome instability and senescence contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Werner syndrome protein's role in DNA damage checkpoint and genomic stability affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DNA repair deficiency driving aging and cancer susceptibility via genomic instability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Replication and Repair Enzyme Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage response pathways as central regulators linking DNA repair defects to aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of DNA damage and genomic instability due to defective repair genes like SGS1.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stochastic accumulation of somatic mutations causing genomic instability and altered gene regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chromosomal abnormalities and aneuploidy as drivers of genomic instability and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights genome instability from DNA damage accumulation driving aging and aging-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links DNA repair gene defects to aging phenotypes including menopause and somatic cell senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of alkylation DNA damage (7-methylguanine) contributing to genomic instability with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes chronic DDR activation triggering proinflammatory signaling and immune responses driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging as repairable damage accumulation with therapies aimed at reversing damage and inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes DNA damage, epigenetic, and protein damage contributing to cellular dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Metabolic Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in mitochondrial oxidative metabolism and its impact on aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Metabolic Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Metabolic Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on macromolecular damage accumulation in lens proteins linked to aging and dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response-Driven Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses slowing aging process and ethical implications, related to managing damage and inflammation.
